result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory A Robinson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Gregory A Robinson in court.  Attorney John Scott Schiro in court for Gregory A Robinson.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. State advises of reports. Defense request decision on motion. Court sets decision hearing. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Decision scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Gregory A Robinson in court.  Attorney John Scott Schiro in court for Gregory A Robinson.  Attorney John J Rejowski in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for motion hearing. For reasons stated on the record, Court holds defense's motion in abeyance. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Defendant's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Requested Jury Instructions, received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
State's Response to Motion for Sevrance.
Defense motion for Severance of Charges, filed.

Defendant Gregory A Robinson in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense advises of motion. Court orders defense motion due by 7-29-2022, state reply 8-19-2022 and any response by 9-20-2022. Court sets Motion hearing/ Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any other motions must be filed by the final pretrial. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gregory A Robinson in court with attorney John Scott Schiro.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Gregory A Robinson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case in court for status conference. Defense requests more time for review. State to provide missing discovery. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Gregory A Robinson in court with attorney John Scott Schiro, appear by video.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer E. Maldonado.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 4.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MAS and Chambers East Food Mart UNLESS for employment purposes.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 05/07/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Attorney Peter John Heflin in court.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 4.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Receipt Number: 22RP017377,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/05/2022@1:30pm
